dmca.title: [EV1-C1608963Q] Notification of Claimed Infringement - EV1-C1552930M version 2
dmca.body:
-----Original Message----- From: abuse@ev1.net [mailto:abuse@ev1.net] Posted At: Tuesday, October 31, 2006 5:13 AM Posted To: DMCA Houston Conversation: [EV1-C1608963Q] Notification of Claimed Infringement - EV1-C1552930M version 2 Subject: [EV1-C1608963Q] Notification of Claimed Infringement - EV1-C1552930M version 2 **Word Document mentioned pasted below: October 30, 2006 To: Attn: Andrea Almeida, Associate General Counsel Everyones Internet 1333 Stemmons Freeway, Suite 110 Dallas, TX 75207 Office: (214) 782-7800 FAX:(214) 782-7756 Email: dmca@ev1.net From: Clinton S. Clark 7150 Cahill Rd #120 Edina, MN 55439-2041 Home: (319) 504-2932 Email: clint.clark.email@gmail.com Subject: Claim of Copyright Infringement by www.liveindia.com Dear Andrea, My name is Clinton S. Clark and I am the owner and author of the copy-written work online at www.pianonanny.com, also known as Piano on the Net. Piano on the Net was established online in February of 1994 and was the first website on the Internet to teach free online piano and music lessons. Piano on the Net has won many awards and has been featured on the NBC Nightly News (June 1998), CNN (October 1997), and in WebMaster (now CIO) Magazine (August 1997). A hosting-account customers of Everyones Internet, Swami Rajesh Chopra (Domain: www.liveindia.com - IP Address: 66.98.156.58), has stolen copy-written material from Piano on the Net and has published it online at www.liveindia.com. Here is a summary of the material he has stolen: http://www.liveindia.com/piano/index.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/1.html http://www.pianonanny.com/2.html Note that throughout, Swami Rajesh Chopra has taken the original graphics from Piano on the Net and shaded them a different color, possibly in an attempt to hide their origin. http://www.liveindia.com/piano/2.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/3.html http://www.pianonanny.com/4.html http://www.liveindia.com/piano/3.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/5.html http://www.pianonanny.com/7.html http://www.liveindia.com/piano/4.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/8.html http://www.pianonanny.com/9.html http://www.liveindia.com/piano/5.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/10.html http://www.pianonanny.com/11.html http://www.liveindia.com/piano/6.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/12.html http://www.pianonanny.com/13.html http://www.liveindia.com/piano/7.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/14.html http://www.pianonanny.com/15.html http://www.liveindia.com/piano/8.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/16.html http://www.pianonanny.com/17.html I am formally requesting that Everyones Internet remove or disable access to this stolen work. Swami Rajesh Chopra can be contacted at: Attn: Rajesh Chopra Live India Internet Services 85, Suvidha Kunj, Pok, H-4&5, Pitampura, New Delhi, Delhi 110034 IN +91-9810058383 fax: +91-11-23868383 liveindia@gmail.com liveindia83@yahoo.com I have a good faith belief that, the use of this work in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law. The information in this notification is accurate, and under penalty of perjury, I am authorized to act on behalf of the owner of exclusive rights for this work that is allegedly infringed. Your help in this matter would be greatly appreciated. Thank you. Sincerely, Clinton S. Clark Signed October 30, 2006. This typed signature serves as my signed written signature, cc: Dave Arringdale at The Nanny Group/ ATSAdvice@aol.com Dan Combs at The Nanny Group/ dan.combs@globalidentitysolutions.com ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. Piano on the Net has won many awards and has been featured on the NBC Nightly News (June 1998), CNN (October 1997), and in WebMaster (now CIO) Magazine (August 1997). A hosting-account customers of Everyones Internet, Swami Rajesh Chopra (Domain: www.liveindia.com - IP Address: 66.98.156.58), has stolen copy-written material from Piano on the Net and has published it online at www.liveindia.com. Here is a summary of the material he has stolen: http://www.liveindia.com/piano/index.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/1.html http://www.pianonanny.com/2.html Note that throughout, Swami Rajesh Chopra has taken the original graphics from Piano on the Net and shaded them a different color, possibly in an attempt to hide their origin. http://www.liveindia.com/piano/2.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/3.html http://www.pianonanny.com/4.html http://www.liveindia.com/piano/3.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/5.html http://www.pianonanny.com/7.html http://www.liveindia.com/piano/4.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/8.html http://www.pianonanny.com/9.html http://www.liveindia.com/piano/5.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/10.html http://www.pianonanny.com/11.html http://www.liveindia.com/piano/6.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/12.html http://www.pianonanny.com/13.html http://www.liveindia.com/piano/7.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/14.html http://www.pianonanny.com/15.html http://www.liveindia.com/piano/8.html from: http://www.pianonanny.com/16.html http://www.pianonanny.com/17.html I am formally requesting that Everyones Internet remove or disable access to this stolen work. Subject: Claim of Copyright Infringement by www.liveindia.com


Dear Andrea,

My name is Clinton S. Clark and I am the owner and author of the copy-written work online at www.pianonanny.com, also known as Piano on the Net. Piano on the Net was established online in February of 1994 and was the first website on the Internet to teach free online piano and music lessons.  Piano on the Net has won many awards and has been featured on the NBC Nightly News (June 1998), CNN (October 1997), and in WebMaster (now CIO) Magazine (August 1997).

A hosting-account customers of Everyones Internet, Swami Rajesh Chopra (Domain: www.liveindia.com - IP Address: 66.98.156.58),
has stolen copy-written material from Piano on the Net and has published it online at www.liveindia.com.

Here is a summary of the material he has stolen:

http://www.liveindia.co m/piano/index.html

from:

http://www.pianonanny.com/1.html
http://www.pianonanny.com/2.html

Note that throughout, Swami Rajesh Chopra has taken the original graphics from Piano on the Net and shaded them a different color, possibly in an attempt to hide their origin.

http://www.liveindia.com/pi ano/2.html

from:

http://www.pianonanny.com/11.ht ml

from:

http://www.pianonanny.com/16.ht ml
http://www.pianonanny.com/17.ht ml


I am formally requesting that Everyones Internet remove or disable access to this stolen work.

Swami Rajesh Chopra can be contacted at:

Your help in this matter would be greatly appreciated.


Thank you.

Clinton S. Clark
